greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation t->t+3 of Z, folded to N.
comment: Corresponds to simple periodic asynchronic site swap pattern ...333333... (performing a three-ball cascade forever).
This permutation consists of just three infinite cycles.
link: Joe Buhler and R. L. Graham, Juggling Drops and Descents, Amer. Math. Monthly, 101, (no. 6) 1994, 507 - 519.
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: Let f: Z -> N be given by f(z) = 2z if z>0 else 2|z|+1, with inverse g(z) = z/2 if z even else (1-z)/2. Then a(n) = f(g(n)+3).
xref: Row 3 of A065167. Inverse permutation: A065170.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 19 2001
